intro: Jacquinia aurantiaca var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, showy white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, contrasting with its bright yellow-green foliage. Its leaves are elliptical and have a leathery texture, typical of many members of the Ericaceae family. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
